item.title: Visible homeless way up in OKC for 2018, overall homeless numbers down
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Point-in-Time Count report on homelessness in Oklahoma City released Thursday showed the total number of homeless people is down, but the homeless living outdoors is up drastically. This year’s count was conducted in the very early hours of January 25 by volunteers coordinated by City of Oklahoma City staff in the Community Development Division […]

The post Visible homeless way up in OKC for 2018, overall homeless numbers down appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: New mural improves evolving Capitol Hill streetscape
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The original Capitol Hill commercial district south across the river from downtown Oklahoma City has gained a new mural created by one of the city’s newer muralists, Sergio Ramirez. The Capitol Hill Civic group toured the mural called “My Brush” Thursday morning between rain showers and heard Ramirez explain the variety of images depicting the […]

The post New mural improves evolving Capitol Hill streetscape appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Diversity marks generations who came to honor war dead in OKC
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Generations of veterans in Donald McClain’s family were quietly present Monday at the Memorial Day ceremony held outside the 45th Infantry Museum at 2145 NE 36th Street. McClain served in Vietnam in 1967. His daughter, Angela Suttles, is a Gulf War veteran. Her husband, Kenneth Suttles is also a veteran. “My dad actually was the […]

The post Diversity marks generations who came to honor war dead in OKC appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Nathan Poppe named editor at Curbside Chronicle
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
In a major career shift, Nathan Poppe has left The Oklahoman, one of the state’s long-standing legacy newspapers, and joins the small, nonprofit Curbside Chronicle as editor. Curbside vendors can be seen in their green smocks selling the slick, impressive magazine produced to help the vendors work their way out of homelessness. But this is […]

The post Nathan Poppe named editor at Curbside Chronicle appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Bike-to-Work Day kicks off with multiple rides
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
About 40 cyclists arrived downtown at the Myriad Gardens after riding to work Friday on national Bike-to-Work Day. It was part of national Bike-to-Work Day that is intended to encourage people to use cycling as a means of commuting instead of using cars. According to Joshua Vaught, general manager of Spokies bike share system, a […]

The post Bike-to-Work Day kicks off with multiple rides appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: As Mother’s Day nears, Curbside Chronicle vendors selling flowers fast
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Coming off of a successful Valentine’s Day season of flower sales, Curbside Chronicle vendors are hard at it again, this time selling flowers for Mother’s Day coming up Sunday. The organization will be selling the bouquets through Sunday. A small bouquet is $12, a medium is $30, and the large bouquetsÂ are $65. The bouquets are […]

The post As Mother’s Day nears, Curbside Chronicle vendors selling flowers fast appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Making of Men conference pushes hope, character
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
“How do we destroy negative stereotypes?” The class of young black men sat attentively and some started saying the word leader Jerry Bull was looking for: “success.” “That’s right,” said the pharmaceutical rep who was just one of many successful black men who had been recruited to lead sessions at the Making of Men Conference […]

The post Making of Men conference pushes hope, character appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Capitol Hispanic Day shows diversity, strength, pride in culture
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The second annual Capitol Hispanic Day Tuesday featured dances and foods of several Latin American countries to expose legislators and Capitol visitors to Oklahoma’s majority-minority culture. And four consulate officials for Mexico, Peru, Spain, and Guatemala, origin countries of Oklahoma’s Hispanic culture, attended and spoke to those gathered for the event. Pride Joyce Thomas from […]

The post Capitol Hispanic Day shows diversity, strength, pride in culture appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC Dodgers adopt alternate name “Cielo Azul” to honor Hispanic fans
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Dodgers Triple-A baseball club has joined 32 other minor league franchises in a special effort to honor their many Hispanic fans. âCielo Azul,â translated âBlue Sky,â is the new alternate name of the team. Dodgers players will wear special uniforms with the alternate name at two home series, a total of eight […]

item.title: Only declared OKC sanctuary church holds vigil at ICE offices
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The only congregation in Oklahoma City to declare itself a sanctuary church held a vigil and accompaniment at the OKC headquarters of the U.S. Customs and Immigration Service Thursday. And the pastor of that congregation says their presence could have been one reason for a woman with an ill child being given 60 more days […]

The post Only declared OKC sanctuary church holds vigil at ICE offices appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
